availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John P. Brown (Spencer County, KY farmer)

body.p: Spencer County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Married Mary E. Tutt on November 24, 1852 in Nelson County. Carpenter in Spencer County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from August 1862 to January 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, p. 483
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Spencer County Marriages, Film #000481509, p. 247
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0039.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Spencer County Administrator Bonds, 1824-1909; Vol A-D (Accessed through ancestry.com on September 16, 2019), p. 1002 of microfilm.
